headline: Is Cheap Venezuelan Crude and Western Gateway Access Altering The Investment Case For Phillips 66 (PSX)?
summary: In January 2026, Phillips 66 moved quickly to secure heavily discounted Venezuelan crude supplies following a U.S. policy shift allowing up to 50 million barrels of imports, while also advancing plans with Kinder Morgan for the Western Gateway refined products pipeline linking midcontinent supply to key Southwest and California markets. Together, access to cheaper heavy crude feedstock and expanded pipeline connectivity could meaningfully influence Phillips 66’s refining economics, product...
